headline: Blonde Brownies
description: These blonde brownies are simple to make with basic pantry staples, chopped nuts, and semisweet chocolate chips for a decadent, chewy, buttery treat.

video.description: This chewy "blondie" is still plenty chocolatey, thanks to the chips on top.
video.name: Blonde Brownies I

name: Blonde Brownies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan.
Sift together sifted flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl. Stir in chopped nuts; set aside.
Mix brown sugar and melted butter in a large bowl until combined; cool slightly.
Stir beaten egg and vanilla into brown sugar mixture. Add flour mixture, a little at a time, mixing just until combined. Spread batter into the prepared baking pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I had morsel bits stirred them in at the end . Very good.

I always double this recipe, it's so delicious and easy. Don't skip sifting the dry ingredients, it makes a difference. Thank you for posting this recipe, I have been making it for years and will pass on to my kids.

Let me start by saying I knew going in I was going to be changing this recipe to gluten-free. I have Bob's Red Mill gluten free flour substitute 1 for 1 and used that. This is for a friend with a wheat allergy. My hubby, who is diabetic, was moaning that he wants some too, and so I will change it again by using half the sugar, and adding in ground flax and wheat germ, and possibly ground quinoa so that he can eat a little and not die on me. They smell wonderful, look great and tomorrow when my friend eats his, I think he will agree they are amazing.

I'm surprised by the amount of high reviews. They're ok. A little doughy, not very flavorful. They're more cakey than crumbly - more squishy than gooey. I will probably make them one more time to see if I made any mistakes but if it's the same result, it's not worth the bake time.
So easy, fast and yummy!!
I watched Glenn and Friends YouTube Channel and saw an episode where he made blondies. I followed your recipe because I love chocolate chips.

Really good and fast! I didn't have eggs on hand so I used 3 Tbsp of Peanut butter and 1 Tbsp of ground flax/chia seeds (I had for protein shakes) soaked in 3 Tbsp of water. I'd never used these substitutions and probably didn't need both, but it worked out deliciously -- especially if you love the taste of peanut butter! I also reduced the brown sugar to 3/4 c and it was plenty. The second time I made them (in the same week!), I made a 13x9" pan and increased all ingredients by 2-1/2 to make them a little thicker. I also decided just to mix the chocolate chips into the dough and it worked perfectly. Might reduce the amount of chips to 1/2 c next time. I'm thinking this is a good dough to switch up with other additives depending on what sounds good that day!
Well, its still in the oven, but we rate the dough 9.5/10. Makes a surprisingly small amount of dough, was amount 1/4 inch thick when pressed into a 9x9 pan.
I made it without the chocolate chips, and my grand babies liked it a lot. I like it, it’s not too sweet, very easy recipe.
Used pecans & chocolate chips both mixed in and on top. Delicious!
My search for a perfect blondies recipe is over. This is the one.

I enjoyed this! I used less baking powder than listed (half) because people noticed it turned cakey, and I did less vanilla than in the recipe. It takes good (very sweet, so if you do not like sweet things probably go with different recipe). I think it is important to make sure it isnt cooked too little. Underbaked will be too squishy, and I think slightly overdone would be better than undercooked.

I made these two days in a row because they were so good! Be careful on the chocolate chips cause they’re on top and they can be gooey. If you cook it the right amount of time they come out delicious!!
I substituted coconut oil for the butter, and omitted the walnuts. They were delicious! Served with coffee ice cream ..yum!

The biggest problem with this recipe is this: THEY ARE DELISH &MY PARTNER & I FINISHED THEM IN ONE DAY!! They could have lasted longer if I practiced self control, but this recipe is so good I threw caution to the wind! Thank You!
So good! This is THE blonde recipe - I’ve made several times, they are the best! This recipe is a keeper!
A+ Delicious! It's so chewy and moist. I will make this many more times. Easy recipe to follow. Love blondies!
fast, easy and so delicious. wasn't expecting them to be as great as they were. don't change a thing, unless it's doubling the recipe lol

This is a family fave recipe, and always receives compliments. Thank you! I omit the walnuts, and use mini m&ms instead of chocolate chips--kids love that. I tend to mix in most of the m&ms, and save some for on top. I also always double it, for a 9x13 pan. Amazing.
AMAZING! Double the recipe for a 9x13 pan. We also add coconut for variety. Or reese's mini eggs and cadbury mini eggs around Easter. There are so many options with this fantastic cookie bar base.
Pretty good however I cut the sugar in half and they were still quite sweet

They were perfect! I adjusted the recipe to make 9 servings. When I did it changed the measurements for the salt, baking soda and baking powered to some weird amounts. I adjusted them to 1/4 tsp for all three and I used 6tablespoons of butter and I used white chocolate chips because that’s what I had. They were rich, moist and out of this world!

I don’t get it. I’ve tried these twice now with the same result. These were way too sweet and way too dense. I followed the recipe exactly bc I won’t review something I have altered, but these lack any depth of flavor. All you taste is sugar.

These were really delicious. I left out the nuts and doubled the recipe. I had only 1 3/4 c dark brown sugar so added a 1/4 c white sugar and creamed one stick of butter. I added a bag of Hershey’s special dark chocolate chips and mixed them in. They were perfect, crispy outside and chewy inside. I saved half for chocolate chip cookies.

Great recipe! Super easy to make & it keeps well & is just as delicious days after it's made. Next time I will try half semi-sweet choc. chips & half butterscotch chips - sure to complement the chewy dough!
Very good would make again. I switched the chocolate chips to cranberries and white chocolate
Very yummy

Had to make a slight adjustment when I doubled the recipe. I added an extra 1/4 c of melted butter at the end as the batter seemed to dry/stiff. Also passed on the chocolate chips in favour of candied sunflower seeds. Cooked in a 9x13 pan for 35-40 min. Rainbow blondies came out amazing!
Just made these and they were extremely delicious! My family loved them! Didn’t change anything about the recipe.
This recipe is incredible and my entire family loved it! I sprinkled some chocolate chips inside the blondie and it was very good this way as well.
I think it turned out great, just needed a little extra time to bake.

First day, just average and a little too sweet. Second day, WOW!!!! These are more like a blondie brownie cookie bars and super good! The only thing I changed was using white chocolate chips because that’s what I had on hand. I wish I would have also added macadamia nuts. These were awesome. 

Also, I can’t believe how rude some of the comments are on here. It’s a shame people can’t say things more nicely.
Loved it!

This was a great recipe! I did mix in the chocolate chips rather than sprinkling on top and they came out delicious. My family ate these up. I baked in a 7”x11” ceramic pan and they were a perfect thickness.
Fantastic ... recipe requested by guests. Used butterscotch bits mixed-in instead of chocolate bits on top. Used two 8x4 loaf pans; all edge and corner pieces!
I made these with some substitutions- swapped macadamia nuts and white choc chips. Turned out delicious but a tad too sweet, so would recommend reducing sugar by 1/4 cup to make this way.

Rated as written: Sweet, Gushy, buttery, chewy Gooey and Chocolatey , if that's your thing this recipe has it all!

Sometimes a person needs a simple but depraved delicious dessert that doesn't require hours of time and fancy things, and this is great, I mean addictive, sure they're extremely sweet and that's not for everyone, but I'm not beating around the sugar bush if I want dessert.

I made this again since I had to make some changes. As written, this recipe is too sweet and a bit salty. I chose to triple the recipe so I could bake it on a large sheet pan but I didn't triple the chocolate chips or nuts as they were way too much in a single recipe. I've been on a brown butter kick lately and this works really well with browned butter...adds a toffee kinda taste. Delicious. I used 2 c. of brown sugar in a tripled recipe and it was perfectly sweet. Also measure your salt very scantly...not quite a full measuring spoon. Ultimately it's a very good recipe, just needed a little tweaking for our family's personal tastes. I suggest making it as written and then tweaking it for yourself...never hurts to have a second batch!

I made this again since I had to make some changes. As written, this recipe is too sweet and a bit salty. I chose to triple the recipe so I could bake it on a large sheet pan but I didn't triple the chocolate chips or nuts as they were way too much in a single recipe. I've been on a brown butter kick lately and this works really well with browned butter...adds a toffee kinda taste. Delicious. I used 2 c. of brown sugar in a tripled recipe and it was perfectly sweet. Also measure your salt very scantly...not quite a full measuring spoon. Ultimately it's a very good recipe, just needed a little tweaking for our family's personal tastes. I suggest making it as written and then tweaking it for yourself...never hurts to have a second batch!

Great recipe! Once the batter is all mixed, I added a little milk because we like ours a little gooey/not as thick. I also added white chocolate chips. I’ve mixed them in the batter once and I’ve also put them on top and when they would start to melt, I would swirl them and make a marble effect. I baked mine for 25 mins or so on 350 and then 10 mins or so on 325 so that the edges and bottom didn’t get too crispy before the middle was done. This helped to keep the texture how we like it...gooey brownies are the best! (Make sure to spray down the pan too... I used a 8x8 glass pan and it was perfect!) Everyone’s ovens and pans are different so a little trial and error to find out what works for you is all it takes. My 5 year old loved helping me with these too. This is now by far my favorite brownie recipe ever and I can’t wait to share with friends and family!
Amazing brownies. I followed the recipe exactly and I was really happy with these brownies.
So good! Use mini choc chips and mix in most but save a few for on top. I used pecans because I was out of walnuts. Will definitely make again!
Loved it! Husband called it “excellent”. I’m not a good cook and am an amateur baker so that’s an incredibly high praise.
Delicious! Only change was pecans instead of walnuts! Melt in your mouth goodness!
Mixed in chips and didn’t include nuts. Yum!
Added some heath toffee bits and kept the nuts out and they are amazing. They have become THE weekend treat! Highly recommend
Delicious and decadent! Followed the recipe exactly. Will definitely make again and probably use less sugar but it was good with the whole cup.
It was amazing i will definitely be making it again.
Absolutely delicious!!!!!!! Loved it!!!!!
I used only 2/3 cup brown sugar and baked it in a 8x8 pan
Great!!
These turned out well, but I wasn’t crazy about the overall flavour or texture.
This was awful. Too sweet, Too much sugar, and as hard as rocks.
Way too cakey. Will make with less baking powder next time.
I made my blondies without any chocolate. Cinsidering this was my first time baking blondies I think the recipe was nice because my blondies come out of the oven smelling glorious.

The only changes I made were to use w/w flour instead of white and mix in raisins instead of chocolate chips. I'm fairly certain this is the same recipe I grew up with. Very Yummy! Only made a single batch because I was afraid I'd eat the entire thing.

Used 1 cup of chips since I ran out of nuts. Wish now I had waited. Also had a hunch about the sweetness level; used 3/4 of a cup of brown sugar. Next time, I'll back it down to 2/3 cup. Still very, very sweet. EASY recipe to make, though. With slight adjustments due to sweetness level, I'll make this over and over. Thanks for the easy method! **Added 1/3 cup of oatmeal and that tempered the sweetness level a bit. Still too sweet - will keep trying since it's so easy to make.

This was my first attempt at making Blondies, I've only ever had them at restaurants. These were delicious! The only change I made was less than the suggested amount of chocolate chips, and I used mini morsels instead of the traditional size. I doubled the recipe, and used 9x9 pans instead of 8x8. These were gobbled up quick at a party we hosted for my brokerage. Will definitely be making these again!
I mixed chocolate chips in the batter and used pecans, turned out fantastic.
Delicious and we really love the balance of chocolate and butterscotch in this recipe with the addition of the chocolate chips! I didn’t change a thing!

I mixed the chocolate chips into the batter. I actually would have liked them to be a little sweeter. I may have baked them slightly longer than I should have, because I like my bar cookies & brownies to be ever so slightly underdone. But I took them to work and got a lot of compliments!

This is the same as mine. Yes, it's great. I usually double the recipe because one is never enough. I got this from my Mother over 50 years ago. Sometimes Mother and I would double the chocolate chips - love chocolate. And yes, I've been asked for the recipe many times.
Glad to know this one is here in case I lose mine.

This is a wonderful recipe!! i used it exactly as written by the OP. It was fantastic. I just made the second batch as the first was used for friends. I plan to use it again and again. I can't wait to put dried cranberries in it but wanted to respect the OP first.

I made this yummy recipe for a family get together. I doubled it as suggested and mixed the chocolate chips into the batter. Later that week I made them for my Son’s workplace. They loved them as well. Great recipe!

made exactly as written. They taste "floury." 
I'll keep looking .
These are so easy and they are Amazing

I totally judge my baked goods by how the batter is. This batter was meh. And I kept checking to see if I had all of the ingredients because it seemed too sugary. Gritty... Lacking in something. I put it on the oven, read the reviews, found someone else thought the same thing. So I pulled them out and started mixing in flour (yep, in the baking dish) until the consistency and pre cooked taste was more to my liking. In the end, we have a winner. I prob doubled the flour. And I also used dairy free butter so my allergy baby could enjoy. Flavor is on point. Thanks for the super easy recipe.
Very easy to make and yummy
This was so easy to make. I mix the chocolate chips in instead of on top. The recipe worked perfectly and is now my go to for Blonde Brownies.
Doubled recipe for my 13x9 pan! Mom loved them so much I'm making them for her birthday.
Yes , I made a marshmallow glaze on top. Yes I hope to bake them again. Thank you for providing the recipe.
Mixed the chocolate chips in the batter, rather than sprinkling on top. Doubled the recipe and baked for 25 min in 9x13 Pyrex pan. They came out perfect.
I followed the recipe exactly, using mini chocolate chips. It was really yummy! I had to let it bake closer to 30 minutes.

Excellent blondies that were moist and chewy. Not too sweet and not gooey. I made a lot of substitutions because I didn't have all the ingredients, but they still turned out great! Subbed in an 8x8 pan, pancake syrup for vanilla, wheat flour for all purpose flour, no chocolate chips or walnuts, and baked for 30 minutes.

Didn't change a thing other than omitting walnuts (allergies) and I tripled the recipe because I needed 48 bars for an event (I used 11 x 17" pan). They turned out perfect! I will use this recipe from now on, and will probably even use as a cookie cake for birthdays.
Great

These were pretty good. I liked how soft and chewy they were even the next day. However, I found them to be a little flavorless. Mostly just very sweet. The only real flavor was the chocolate chips. I would have liked the actual blondie part to have more of a flavor than just sweet. I enjoyed eating them but probably won’t make them again.

I doubled the recipe, used 1/3C chocolate and 1/3C white chocolate chips, and cut back on the vanilla to 1tsp per recipe. Since I doubled the recipe I used 2tsp vanilla. We really liked these, but they turned out a little bit dry (possibly due to over baking). Next time I make them I definitely won’t bake longer than 25min and will update the rating if they turn out less dry.
My family claims this is the best blondie I've made. Loved it!!! I did not add chocolate chips at all, and still came out perfect.

I doubled the recipe, used a 13x9 pan. I spread 2/3 of the batter and covered that with shredded almond bark. Then I used an ice cream scoop to dollup remaining batter on top and spread a little. I then took caramel filled chocolate candies and spaced them out on top.
Thanks for sharing such a great simple recipe!

These are awesome. I've made many times using a different combination of baking chips and nuts, sometimes leaving out the nuts all together. I don't even use a mixer with these bars, just mix it all by hand in one bowl. I combine the dry ingredients first, then add the brown sugar, melted butter combined with vanilla, and beaten egg, then I mix with wooden spoon. Using a mixer will beat more air into batter, making for a more cakey brownie, and these are meant to be chewey and "fudgy," not cake-like. Do not overbake these brownies. They will continue to bake after you take them out of the oven. I bake for 23 minutes in my over and take them out just as the top turns goldern brown. I've made these with almonds and white chocolate chips, semi-sweet chips and toffee bits, and milk chocolate chips and pecans. These are just so easy, and everyone likes them.
I will definitely make it again.

Vanilla flavor is overwhelming. Is there an error in the recipe and the vanilla should be a teaspoon and not a Tablespoon? I love blondies but this was not good at all. These didn’t rise and while the knife came out clean, they seemed to be undercooked.
Winner winner chicken dinner

It’s so good!! I’ve been making this recipe for 4 years now and it’s so consistent. It’s my go to dessert for any occasion, it never disappoints and it’s still moist and chewy a couple days after baking! 10/10 recommend

I thought these were good, not outstanding, but good. It’s basically just a big cookie, not a brownie. I doubled the recipe, but wish I would not have doubled the salt as it was a bit too much. Otherwise the flavor is good, not too sweet. It does bake up nicely and rises, but the edges were too crisp for my liking and the batter was hard to work with. I’m not sure if I’ll make again, maybe just as a large cookie cake or something instead of blonde brownies. My husband really liked them and so did the kiddo, but it was just a meh for me.
My 10 yr old granddaughter made these almost completely by herself. I love that they use basic pantry ingredients I always have on hand. They turned out great!

Great recipe! Only change I did was to mix some chocolate chips in the batter and then topped the batter with some....which is not really a change. WHAT A TREAT! My only wish is if we had some ice cream in the house to dollop on top... not needed at all but oh it would put this over the top! Please ignore any of the naysayers ...if you are craving something decadent.
It was very good, but kind of bland even with the chocolate chips.
Looks like a giant cookie!
So good!!! Super chewy and crunchy and easy!! Highly recommend!!
I made a double batch yesterday, and I loved them so much I made 4 more batches for work for tomorrow! 1 big pan with just Chocolate chips and 1 I did with Chocolate chips and Pecans
awesome.
Baking time is inaccurate, more like 30-35 minutes.

I loved the texture of these, but something was missing. The taste was like a chocolate chip cookie.... that someone forgot to add the chocolate chips too. The sugary sweetness over powered the chocolate chips in it. I would not make this again.
yummy!
Doubled the recipe and added about 1 cup of chocolate chips mixed into the batter. This recipe is a winner!
Great recipe. I added more chocolate chips and mixed in.
